title: Temple on top of a mountain in rural Spain advertises for a care taker
text:
282 shares 30
View
comments
A remote temple on top of a mountain in rural eastern Spain is offering one lucky applicant the chance to escape the rat race and live the simple life.
The board of the Virgin of the Rock are offering a year's contract to the successful applicant, who is expected to advertising for a hermit to take care of its property, and must agree to leave behind 'all uncivilized and immoral activity' to qualify for the job.
In exchange, the post offers free accommodation at the temple of the Mare de Deu de la Roca located in the village of Mont-roig del Camp, in the eastern Spanish province of Tarragona in the Catalonia region.
Scroll down for video
No details were given on the salary but whoever gets the job will have to pay for any damage to the property
The temple of the Mare de Deu de la Roca, on top of a mountain in eastern Spain, where a hermit is required
The job has been advertised on Facebook and the successful applicant would have to spend a year there continuously, and take care of the cleaning of the church, the house, the square, the services and the local environment.

Share this article Share No details were given on the salary but the new hermit will have to pay a deposit of 1,000 euros, around Â£729 for any damage that happens to the property while they are in charge.
The successful applicant, it says, will also have knowledge of restoration and customer services in order to service dining and lodging requirements at the sanctuary.
The applicant will have to take care of the cleaning of the church, the house, the square and the local environment
The board added that it would be an added bonus if the applicant could also speak Catalan, and have knowledge of other languages.
In particular the offer said that: 'The person who will take care of the temple should bear in mind the religious and cultural character of the sanctuary, leaving out all uncivilized and immoral activity.'
The offer is open until 31 August and applications must be submitted to the local entity.
In exchange for their hard work, the post offers free accommodation at the temple to the successful applicant
The temple of Mare de Deu de la Roca is located on top of a rock in the mountain and is associated with a legend.A Moor king is believed to have stolen jewellery from the temple and escaped on horseback. But he was then was struck by lightning and tumbled off the cliff.
Legend has it, that some nights the silhouette of the king and the horse can be seen on the other side of the cliff.
